WRITING.TEXT: Yeah it did a while back.
Yeah once I played Lucio on KotH and got 96% of the match MVP so basically on fire, the amount you got as support was pretty insane.

I don't think Lucio deserves a big nerf or something, I do think they should change back the wallrun ability so it's not infinite and actually has a skill ceiling to it rather than everyone can ride walls forever.
For Zen I think a small nerf could be to change back the speed at which discord orbs move to the enemies because now it's basically instantly.

I guess that's true that people would focus on getting kills way more, however for me it made me play slightly more defensive instead of being kill hungry. I loved getting those huge kill streaks like 25+ or something, but the reason you gave for removing it is a pretty valid one.
The main reason I find it annoying is because now the quickplay stats are way different compared to the competitive ones.

WRITING.TITLE: Why do killstreaks not carry over from round to round anymore?
WRITING.TEXT: I remember that killstreaks used to carry on from round to round, it wouldn't say it on the screen but it still counted if you pressed tab. Why did they change this? It's kinda impossible to get those huge killstreaks again, my quickplay and competitive killstreaks aren't even close to each other now.

So what we have to do is look at the game itself, look at the health of the community itself and say, OK, is this actually going to translate to TV? Counter-Strike lends itself perfectly. There are nuances, but at its very basic level, you understand it. We feel like a game like that translates really well. We just announced that were doing Overwatch. Overwatch is a first-person shooter. Again, basic concepts of the game, its very similar.
Have to agree that CS is one of the easier game to watch, it explains itself quite well after watching for a bit. Overwatch on the otherhand you'll probably have no idea what's going on most of the time as a NEW viewer. You kind of have to have played the game to understand it well.

WRITING.TEXT: Out of their 49 games in June they only lost one, they've played 23 matches this month and won all. Overall they've played 156 matches and won 144, a winrate of 92% which is actually insane.

Also the memories, really miss the IBP line-up.
